item.name: Mugbear
entries: This miraculous mug can be picked up from up to 10 feet away without needing to lean or move toward it.

item.name: Leomund's Tiny Cup
entries: This tiny cup holds about a thimble's worth of drink. The drink is always the perfect temperature and briefly fills you with a comforting warmth when you drink it.

item.name: Yeast Sense
entries: This thick, brothy beer tastes like bread. The first time you see a piece of bread after drinking this beer, you percieve the world as if you were the bread, seeing and hearing from its space. While doing so, you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own surroundings. These effects last for 1 minute or until you take damage.

item.name: Cause Beer
entries: This golden ale allows you to share the sensations of inebriation. When you drink this ale, once before your next long rest, you can choose up to three creatures you can see within 30 feet. Each creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become inebriated and {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the effects on a success.

item.name: Potion of MADNESS
entries: This squirming liquid appears to change color and consistency constantly. You gain {@dice 2d10} temporary hitpoints when you drink this potion and trigger a {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB}.

item.name: MADNESS Tattoo
entries: Produced by even gods don't know what, this magic tattoo features a constantly shifting and squiggly spiral pattern that seems to change between various red and yellow hues randomly.

As an action You can cast the {@spell confusion|phb} spell (DC 15) one time without material components. The tattoo glows faintly while you cast the spell and for the spell's duration. Once the spell ends, the tattoo vanitheys from your skin.

item.name: +1 Poisoner's Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +1 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 5 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting poisons only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +1 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +2 Poisoner's Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +2 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 7 charges, and regains {@dice 1d6+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting poisons only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +2 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +3 Poisoner's Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +3 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 9 charges, and regains {@dice 1d8+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting poisons only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +3 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +1 Herbalism Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +1 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 5 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting potions only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +1 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +2 Herbalism Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +2 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 7 charges, and regains {@dice 1d6+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting potions only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +2 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +3 Herbalism Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +3 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 9 charges, and regains {@dice 1d8+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting potions only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +3 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: Xerc's Tin Foil Hat
entries: This tin foil hat is not actually magical in any way but if the wearer believes strongly enough that it is, it grants them advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition frightened|phb}.

item.name: Xerc's Medicinal Cheese
entries: This foul smelling cheese appears to be covered in cat hairs and can be used to restore vitality...somehow.
When a creature consumes this cheese as a bonus action, they can instantly expend and roll one Hit Die, they then regain hit points equal to the result of the roll + their Constitution modifier.

item.name: Xerc's Unicorn Totem
entries: This carved pale wood totem resembles a unicorn's head. While attuned to this item, you know the {@spell gust|xge} and {@spell magic stone|xge} cantrips and Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for them.

When you cast the gust cantrip, the air erupts from your mouth and smells distictly of cheese. Similarly, the stones you imbue with the magic stone cantrip smell of cheese for the duration of the spell.

item.name: Xerc's WeeWoo Bardiche
entries: Wielded by the mighty orc chieftain Xerc, this polearm appears as brutal as it is deadly. It also goes "WeeWoo" very loudly when danger is near
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, except when {@condition incapacitated} by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

item.name: +1 Tooth of Abyssos
entries: This long and thin tooth allegedly originates from an ancient and monstorous child of Typhon.
While holding this tooth, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an action while holding the tooth. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +2 Tooth of Abyssos
entries: This long and thin tooth allegedly originates from an ancient and monstorous child of Typhon. Since its discovery, it has been enhanced by Teximus of Thalia and also by a chaotic being from the realms of Madness.
While holding this tooth, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an action while holding the tooth. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

Finally, when you cast a warlock spell using this tooth, you can roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the Player's Handbook. If the result is a spell that normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration. If you roll a 99 or higher, you regain an expended warlock spell slot.

item.name: Broddah's Clockhand Maul
entries: This large bronze clockhand was found fused with stone in the volcano of Thalia. It's possible this was intended as a challenge for adventurers to free the hand from the stone. Unfotunately, the most recent adventurer to come across it, simply took the stone along with the hand.
This weapon uses the statistics of a {@item maul|phb}, but is otherwise considered an improvised weapon.

item.name: Broddah's Clockhand Longsword
entries: This large bronze clockhand was found in the volcano of Thalia.
This weapon uses the statistics of a {@item longsword|phb}, but is otherwise considered an improvised weapon.

item.name: Broddah's Clockhand Shortsword
entries: This narrow bronze clockhand was once wielded by an {@creature fire elemental myrmidon|mpmm} in the volcano of Thalia. It was very proud it.
This weapon uses the statistics of a {@item shortsword|phb}, but is otherwise considered an improvised weapon.

item.name: Watermelon of Healing
entries: This watermelon was grown using an infusion of various elixirs, protecting it from decay and granting restorative properties when consumed. It weighs {@dice 3d6+12} pounds when found. Some variants are magically flavored to taste like all manor of foodstuffs.

You can use an action to eat a number of pounds of the watermelon and regain {@dice 1d4+1} hit points for each pound consumed. If you attempt to consume 4 pounds or more in a single action, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + pounds consumed), or fail to regain any hit points and become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn as you begin vomiting profusely.

Additionally, If you consume 15 pounds or more in a single turn without failing the saving throw, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against creatures that saw you consume the melon for the next minute.

item.name: Broddah's Wooden Cup
entries: This simple looking wooden cup holds a fragment of legacy from those who love Broddah, his family, his friends and all those whom he has helped and brought joy to.

Whilst Broddah is alive, only he can attune to this item and it does not count against the number of items he has attuned to. If Broddah is dead, and a creature attempts to attune to this item, Broddah's soul can choose to allow or deny the attunement.
When you drink from this cup while attuned, invisible spirits of Broddah's loved ones lend their strength to yours. You gain the following benefits until you finish your next long rest:

items: When you take the {@action Grapple} or {@action Shove} action, you can target a creature of any size. If the target is more than two sizes larger than you, it has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to avoid or escape your grapple or shove.
Moving with a grappled creature that is your size or smaller no longer halves your movement speed.

item.name: Broddah's Adamantine Cup
entries: This elaborate but slightly melted adamantine cup holds a fragment of the connections and affection Broddah has fostered with divine beings, primarily Dionysus.

Whilst Broddah is alive, only he can attune to this item and it does not count against the number of items he has attuned to. If Broddah is dead, and a creature attempts to attune to this item, Broddah's soul can choose to allow or deny the attunement.

When you drink heavily from this cup while attuned, your mind briefly reaches a higher (or lower) state of being, allowing you to converse with a divine being in a similarly intoxicated state and that is familiar to Broddah, usually Dionysus. You can cast the {@spell commune|phb} spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast the spell using this item, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: The Morning Herald
entries: This modified brass and redwood giff training pistol was given to Bonnie O'Flynn by Horatio Kalthoff as he trained her to wield, repair and modify firearms. It is noticably heavier than a typical pistol and features two vertically stacked barrels, each with their own wheel and trigger. Firing this pistol is extremely loud, hence its name.

item.name: The Gift
entries: This ornate black and silver musket was given to Bonnie O'Flynn by a late friend. It has cleary seen much use, as well as many repairs and modifications throughout the years. It also features the name 'Amanda' crudely carved into the stock.

monster.name: Aisling (Young)
languages: knows the languages Thena does but does not speak

trait.name: Draconic Essence (Fire) & Secondary Essence (Radiant)
entries: Aisling is immune to fire damage. Their Breath Weapon and Destructive maw traits use fire damage.
Aisling is also immune to radiant damage. Whenever they use their Breath Weapon or Destructive Maw trait, they can choose to use radiant in place of fire.

trait.name: Destructive Maw
entries: Aisling deals an extra {@dice 1d10} damage with their bite attack (included in the attack). The extra damage is of of the type associated with their Draconic Essence trait.

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks
entries: Aisling has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with their bite and claw attacks (included in the attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Aisling makes three attacks: one with their bite and two with their claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage and {@h}5 ({@dice 1d10}) fire or radiant damage (your choice).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Aisling exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is of the type associated with Aisling's Draconic Essence trait.

reaction.name: Protect Rider
entries: When an attack would target a creature mounted on Aisling, Aisling can use a reaction to force the attack to target them instead.

monster.name: Terrorwing (Young)
languages: knows the languages Agrax does but does not speak

trait.name: Draconic Essence (Acid)
entries: Terrorwing is immune to acid damage. Their Breath Weapon uses acid damage.

trait.name: Construct Design
entries: Terrorwing's creature type is contruct rather than dragon. They are immune to disease, poison, psychic and the {@condition poisoned} condition. They also do not need to eat, drink, breathe or sleep and magic cannot put it to sleep.

trait.name: Iron Will
entries: Terrorwing is immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

trait.name: Enhanced Defence
entries: Terrorwing has a +1 bonus to their Armor Class and saving throws (included).

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If damage would reduce the terrorwing to 0 hit points, they instead drop to 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Terrorwing makes three attacks: one with their bite and two with their claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Terrorwing exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is of the type associated with Terrorwing's Draconic Essence trait.

reaction.name: Protect Rider
entries: When an attack would target a creature mounted on Terrorwing, Terrorwing can use a reaction to force the attack to target them instead.

monster.name: Undead Bulker
languages: understands the languages you know but doesn't speak

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the bulker moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a maul attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone|XPHB}. If the target is prone, the bulker can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the bulker to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the bulker drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bulker makes a number of attacks equal to your half your PB (rounded up).

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@damage 1d10 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage (your choice).

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. {@damage 1d12 + PB} bludgeoning damage.

fluff: Undead bulkers are ancient reanimated beasts. Compared to undead prowlers and soarers, bulkers excel in raw strength, resilience and momentum. They can handle, and deal, significant damage with ease.
Beasts that might be reanimated as bulkers might include ankylosaurs, triceratops, mammoths, wholly rhinos or helicoprions.

monster.name: Undead Prowler
languages: understands the languages you know but doesn't speak

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the prowler moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the bulker to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the bulker drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

trait.name: Cunning Combatant
entries: The prowler can use a bonus action to take the Dodge, Disengage, Help or Hide action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prowler makes a number of attacks equal to your half your PB (rounded down).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@damage 1d10 + PB} piercing damage.

fluff: Undead prowlers are ancient reanimated beasts. Compared to undead bulkers and soarers, prowlers excel in stealth, speed and tactics. Lurking in the shadows or surrounding enemies alongside allies.
Beasts that may be reanimated as prowlers might include deinonychuses, dire-wolves, sabre-toothed tigers or anomalocarididae.

monster.name: Undead Soarer
languages: understands the languages you know but doesn't speak

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The soarer doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The soarer has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the bulker to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the bulker drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prowler makes a number of attacks equal to your half your PB (rounded down).

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@damage 1d8 + PB} piercing damage.

fluff: Undead soarers are ancient reanimated beasts. Compared to undead bulkers and prowlers, soarers excel at traversal and reconnaissance. Typically great flyers, they can quickly scour the land from above to spot both threats and prey.
Beasts that may be reanimated as prowlers might include pteranodons or various birds of prey.

monster.name: Undead Rex
languages: understands the languages you know but doesn't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the rex to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the rex drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rex makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 1d12}) necrotic damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the rex can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Artillerist's Eye (CR 2 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: Immediately after making an attack or damage roll with a ranged weapon, the artillerist can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled to the total.

action.name: Multiattack (CR 4 or Higher)
entries: The artillerist makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Ranged Weapon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage PBd6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Sidearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Volley (CR 8 or Higher, 1/Day)
entries: The artillerist rains down a hail of ammunition or weapons in a 20-foot sphere centred on a point it can see within 60 feet. Each creature within the area must make a {@dc 12+PB} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage PBd10} piercing damage. A creature takes half as much on a success.

bonus.name: Overwatch (CR 6 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: The artillerist  can ready a ranged weapon attack as a bonus action.

From slingers to archers to javelin throwers, artillerists are the standard ranged warriors of most armies. While their skills and equipment can vary greatly, they specialise in dealing damage from a distance, supporting allied infantry while in turn being protected from enemy infantry.

entries.name: Artillerists across the Multiverse
entries: In Cyranos, the term Toxotai is often used to describe artillerists. Despite the term normally relating specifically to archers, the term can be loosely used for any light artillery.

Similarly, in the Northlands, the term Bogmadr is used as a blanket term for multiple forms of artillery, despite literraly refering to archers. Bogmadr can most often be found on ships and protecting forts.

entries.name: Using Scaling Statblocks
entries: This statblock is intended to be a generic creature that can be quickly inserted into a variety of situations and at a variety of power levels. The hope is that statblocks like this one can provide simple and quick ways to bolster combat encounters or create simple encounters on the fly. They are not, however, intended to provide the drama and complexity of major climatic battles. As such, it is recomended that you use these statblocks alongside more specialised ones, rather than purely scaling ones, particulary for the more dramatic encounters.

These statblocks can be used at any CR within the range described in the tag. For example, a creature with the "Scaling 1-10" tag can be used at any CR between 1 and 10. It is possible to use it at other CRs but not recomended.

variant.name: Optional Extras
entries: At the DM's discretion, the artillerist may gain additional traits to add more flavor and diversity to the characters faced by the party. The following are appropriate examples of such traits. The DM may also wish to add racial traits, such as a dragonborn's breath weapon.

items: {@b Arcane Weapon}. The artillerist's Ranged or Thrown Weapon attack and Volley deals a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Darkvison}. The artillerist has darkvision out to 60 feet.
{@b Resistance}. The artillerist has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

{@b Yanking Shot (CR 2 or Higher, 3/Day)}. When the artillerist hits a creature with a ranged attack, the weapon or ammunition magically returns to the toxotai's hand or quiver. The creature hit by the attack is pulled towards the toxotai up to a number of feet equal to 5xPB.
{@b Piercing Shot (CR 4 or Higher, 3/day)}. When the artillerist hits with ranged weapon attack, they can deal {@dice 1d8} piercing damage to a second target within 5 feet of the first target.

{@b Pinning Shot (CR 6 or Higher, 3/day)}. When the artillerist hits a creature with ranged weapon attack, it can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 12+PB). On a failure, the creature is {@condition slowed|J:general} until the start of the artillerist's next turn. On a success, the creature is instead {@condition hampered|J:general} for the same duration.

trait.name: Reckless Attacks
entries: At the start of its turn, the hulk can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Forceful Strikes (CR 2 or Higher)
entries: Once per turn, when the brute hits a Medium or smaller creature with a melee attack, it can push that creature 10 feet away from it.

trait.name: Hardy (CR 8 or Higher)
entries: The brute has resistance to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack (CR 4 or Higher)
entries: The hulk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Heavy Melee Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4+PB} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage PBd8 + 4} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Sidearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

bonus.name: Furious Action (CR 6 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: The brute takes one of the following actions as a bonus action; {@action Attack} (one melee weapon attack only), {@action Grapple} or {@action Shove}.
Hulk are imposing figures on the battlefield, masters of taking, and dealing, damage.

entries.name: Using Scaling Statblocks
entries: This statblock is intended to be a generic creature that can be quickly inserted into a variety of situations and at a variety of power levels. The hope is that statblocks like this one can provide simple and quick ways to bolster combat encounters or create simple encounters on the fly. They are not, however, intended to provide the drama and complexity of major climatic battles. As such, it is recomended that you use these statblocks alongside more specialised ones, rather than purely scaling ones, particulary for the more dramatic encounters.

These statblocks can be used at any CR within the range described in the tag. For example, a creature with the "Scaling 1-10" tag can be used at any CR between 1 and 10. It is possible to use it at other CRs but not recomended.

variant.name: Optional Extras
entries: At the DM's discretion, the shieldbearer may gain additional traits to add more flavor and diversity to the characters faced by the party. The following are appropriate examples of such traits. The DM may also wish to add racial traits, such as a dragonborn's breath weapon.

items: {@b Arcane Weapon}. The hulk's Heavy Melee Weapon attack deals a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Darkvison}. The hulk has darkvision out to 60 feet.
{@b Resistance}. The hulk has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Frenzy}. When an allied creature the hulk can see within 30 feet is damaged by an attack, the hulk can use a reaction to move up to half its speed towards the attacker.

trait.name: Shields Up
entries: While wielding a shield and within 5 feet of a friendly creature that is also wielding a shield, both the shieldbearer and the creature gain a +1 bonus to their AC and saving throws. Multiple creatures can benefit from this trait, but each creature can only benefit once at a time, even if another creature within 5 feet has this trait.

action.name: Multiattack (CR 4 or Higher)
entries: The shieldbearer makes two Spear or Sidearm attacks. It can replace one attack with a Shield Bash attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage PBd6 + 3} piercing damage or {@h}{@damage PBd8 + 3} piercing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they must succeed on a {@dc 12+PB} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sidearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

bonus.name: Goad (3/Day)
entries: The shieldbearer chooses a creature it can see within 30 feet that can see or hear the shieldbearer. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 12+PB}) or become {@condition taunted|J:general} by the shieldbearer until the start of the shieldbearer's next turn.

bonus.name: Quickdraw
entries: When the shieldbearer makes a ranged Spear attack, it can make a Sidearm Attack as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Spear Guard (CR 2 or Higher)
entries: When a creature enters the shieldbearer's reach, it can make a special opportunity attack, using its Spear attack, against that creature.

reaction.name: Protection (CR 6 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the shieldbearer is targetted by an attack, the shieldbearer can impose disadvantage on the attack roll. It must be wielding a shield to use this feature.

Shieldbearers are the standard heavy infantry of most armies. Armed with shields and spears, shieldbearers are trained to protect themselves and allies, often forming defensive lines between the enemy and their objective.

entries.name: Using Scaling Statblocks
entries: This statblock is intended to be a generic creature that can be quickly inserted into a variety of situations and at a variety of power levels. The hope is that statblocks like this one can provide simple and quick ways to bolster combat encounters or create simple encounters on the fly. They are not, however, intended to provide the drama and complexity of major climatic battles. As such, it is recomended that you use these statblocks alongside more specialised ones, rather than purely scaling ones, particulary for the more dramatic encounters.

These statblocks can be used at any CR within the range described in the tag. For example, a creature with the "Scaling 1-10" tag can be used at any CR between 1 and 10. It is possible to use it at other CRs but not recomended.

variant.name: Optional Extras
entries: At the DM's discretion, the shieldbearer may gain additional traits to add more flavor and diversity to the characters faced by the party. The following are appropriate examples of such traits. The DM may also wish to add racial traits, such as a dragonborn's breath weapon.

items: {@b Arcane Weapon}. The shieldbearer's Spear attack deals a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Darkvison}. The shieldbearer has darkvision out to 60 feet.
{@b Resistance}. The shieldbearer has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

trait.name: Minion
entries: The recruit is a minion as described on page 10 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions. If the recruit takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the recruit takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Shields Up (CR 2 or Higher)
entries: While wielding a shield and within 5 feet of a friendly creature that is also wielding a shield, both the recruit and the creature gain a +1 bonus to their AC and saving throws. Multiple creatures can benefit from this trait, but each creature can only benefit once at a time, even if another creature within 5 feet has this trait.

trait.name: Enhanced Attack
entries: When the recruit hits a creature with a group attack and at least three recruits joined in the attack, the recruit can impose one of the following effects:

items: {@b Overwhelm (CR 4 or Higher).} The target is {@condition hampered|J:General} until the end of its next turn.
{@b Penetrate (CR 6 or Higher).} The recruit deals damage to another creature within 5 feet of the target equal to half the attack's damage. The effect can only be used for a melee Spear attack.
{@b Eviserate (CR 8 or Higher).} The target begins {@condition bleeding|J:general}.

action.name: Spear (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1 + PB} piercing damage.

action.name: Sidearm (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1 + PB} slashing damage.
Recruits are often the lowest ranked and least experienced troops in any army, however, they do usually have some training and can often be effective in large teams.

entries.name: Using Scaling Statblocks
entries: This statblock is intended to be a generic creature that can be quickly inserted into a variety of situations and at a variety of power levels. The hope is that statblocks like this one can provide simple and quick ways to bolster combat encounters or create simple encounters on the fly. They are not, however, intended to provide the drama and complexity of major climatic battles. As such, it is recomended that you use these statblocks alongside more specialised ones, rather than purely scaling ones, particulary for the more dramatic encounters.

These statblocks can be used at any CR within the range described in the tag. For example, a creature with the "Scaling 1-10" tag can be used at any CR between 1 and 10. It is possible to use it at other CRs but not recomended.

variant.name: Optional Extras
entries: At the DM's discretion, the recruit may gain additional traits to add more flavor and diversity to the characters faced by the party. The following are appropriate examples of such traits. The DM may also wish to add racial traits, such as a dragonborn's breath weapon.

items: {@b Arcane Weapon}. The recruit's Spear Attack deals a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Darkvison}. The artillerist has darkvision out to 60 feet.

trait.name: Invigorating Knowledge
entries: Learning new things or successfully applying existing knowledge grants Barabak an inspiring feeling of satisfaction. When he succeeds on an Intelligence check, or a creature he aids with the Help action succeeds on an Intelligence check, he can gain temporary hit points equal to twice his Intelligence modifier (Minimum of 1).

trait.name: Studious Slasher
entries: Barabak uses Intelligence in place of Strength when attacking with slashing weapons (included in the attack).

trait.name: Scholarly Expertise
entries: Barabak doubles his proficiency bonus, provided he doesn't already, for any checks relating to Trenin politics and to mercantile.

trait.name: Trivial Arcanecraft
entries: Barabak can cast the following spells at-will; {@spell dancing lights|phb}, {@spell detect magic|phb}, {@spell message|phb} or {@spell shocking grasp}. Intelligence is his spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Arcanecraft (3/Long Rest)
entries: Barabak can cast one of the following spells at 3rd-level; {@spell analyze weakness|J:lore}, {@spell borrowed knowledge|scc}, {@spell color spray|phb}, {@spell counterspell|phb}, {@spell darklight|J:Lore}, {@spell illusory script}, {@spell stagger/sunder|J:lore}, or {@spell sending|phb}. Intelligence is his spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Barabak has proficiency with the following; {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, {@item cartographer's tools|phb}, {@item forgery kit|phb} and {@item dragonchess set|phb}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Baraback makes two weapon attacks, he can replace one of these attacks with a use of Tactical Guide.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Baba's Axe
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tactical Guide (5/Long Rest)
entries: Barabak chooses a creature he can see within 30 feet that can see or hear him. That creature can immediately take one of the following actions as a reaction:

items: One weapon attack. On a hit, the attack deals an additional {@dice 1d8} damage.
Move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Attempt to break out of a grapple. The creature has a {@dice 1d8} bonus to the check.
Cast a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action or bonus action.

action.name: Group Maneuvers (1/Long Rest)
entries: Barabak chooses up to four creatures he can see within 30 feet. Each chosen creature can use its reaction to move up to half its movement and take one action or one bonus action.

action.name: That was the plan all along (1/1)
entries: Barabak retroactively causes something beneficial to happen. The effect must be something within reason for Barabak, the Birds of Prey or their agents to have achieved, even if it requires incredible foresight. For example, he might declare that agents have already unlocked a door ahead of time, eliminated or distracted a small group of guards, discovered a secret passage or something else the DM deems appropriate.

bonus.name: Helpful
entries: Barabak takes the {@action Help} action. he can target a creature up 30 feet away.

Barabak is the owner and barkeep of the Flaming Talon bastion. He is also the leader and tactician of the Birds of Prey. With some talents in martial combat and the arcane arts, Barabak's biggest strength is his strategic mind. Whether its managing a tavern, playing dragon chess or planning an insurection, Barabak is rather gifted.

Barabak's grandmother, Baba, lives with him and sometimes works in the Flaming Talon. While clearly elderly and sometimes spacey, Baba has lived a rich life, occassionaly regaling the more patient patron with tales of adventuring and combat.

trait.name: Dwarvern Resilience
entries: Gimmer has advantage on saving throws against posion damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition, and has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Dirty Strike (5/Long Rest)
entries: When Gimmer hits a creature with an attack, he can deal an additional 1d10 damage and impose one of the following effects (DC equals 8 + PB + Strength modifier):

items: The target makes a Strength saving throw or is knocked {@condition prone}.
The target makes a Strength saving throw or is knocked 15 feet away from Gimmer.
The target makes a Dexterity saving throw or is {@condition sundered|J:general} (if piercing) or {@condition staggered|J:general} (if bludgeoning) until the start of Gimmer's next turn.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Gimmer has proficiency with the following; {@item mason's tools|phb}, {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item bagpipes|phb} and {@item dice set|phb}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gimmer makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shovel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Miner Mob (1/1)
entries: A group of miners, including Gimmer and Lyeslyn, are roused into performing a favour for you. The favour must be something reasonable for a mob of workers to achieve, such as small protest or riot, hiding something in the mines or damaging an unguarded structure made of stone. Lyeslyn will make sure the mob scatters before they are in real danger.

bonus.name: Scrapper
entries: Gimmer takes the {@action Grapple} or {@action Shove} action.

bonus.name: Second Wind (1/Long Rest)
entries: Gimmer regains 30 hit points

reaction.name: Revenger's Mark (3/Long Rest)
entries: When a creature deals damage to Gimmer or he fails a saving throw imposed by them, Gimmer can use a reaction to cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|PHB} against the creature. Damage does not break Gimmer's concentration in this spell.
Gimmer is a miner, and also a warrior within the Birds of Prey. While stocky and strong like many laboring dwarves, Gimmer is cunning and known to fight dirty.

Gimmer lives with his parents. His mother, Lyeslyn, is also a miner and commands much respect within the Stone District. His father, Sarthel, is a baker and the homemaker of the family. Together the family took Thena Bea Dakestus in, during her first time in Trenin, giving her the family she never really had at home.

trait.name: Enchanting Melodies
entries: Helith can cast the following cantrips at will; {@spell message|phb}, {@spell prestidigitation|phb} and {@spell vicious mockery|phb}. Charisma is her spellcasting ability for these cantrips.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Helith has proficiency with the following; {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb}, {@item drum|phb}, {@item flute|phb}, {@item lute|phb}, {@item lyre|phb}, {@item pan flute|phb} and {@item playing cards|phb}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blowgun Flute
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Disorienting Song (3/Long Rest)
entries: Helith chooses a creature she can see and forces them to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Wisdom modifier). On a fail, a creature gains one of the following conditions for 1 minute or until Helith loses concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). A creature can repeat the saving at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

items: {@condition Charmed|phb} by an ally Helith chooses. The condition is removed early if the charmer damages the charmed creature.
{@condition Distracted|J:General}.
{@condition Frightened|phb} by an ally Helith chooses.
{@condition Taunted|J:General} by an ally Helith chooses. The condition is removed early if the creature is damaged by a creature other than the taunter.

action.name: Crowd Work (1/Long Rest)
entries: Helith targets up to 6 creatures she can see within 30 feet and that can hear her. Each creature has a {@dice 1d6} bonus or penalty (Helith's choice for each creature) to all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws they make for 1 minute.

action.name: I'll pluck a few strings (1/1)
entries: Helith calls upon her connections within the Golden Lyre to gain some favor. The favor must be something feasible for a network of bards to achieve, such as calling a troupe of performers to distract a group, spreading a coded message or rumor or anything else the DM deems appropriate.

bonus.name: (De)Motivate (5/Long Rest)
entries: Helith chooses a creature she can see within 30 feet and that can hear her. That creature has a 1d6 bonus or penalty (Helith's choice) on the next ability check, attack roll or saving throw they make before Helith's next turn.

Helith is a human bard, member of the Golden Lyre, and member of the Birds of Prey, Helith is something of a gossiper, and her connections to the Golden Lyre only enhance this. Helith is remarkably capable of wielding this trait to spread and gather information quickly and broadly, greatly aiding the Birds of Prey.

Helith served as something of a mentor for Thena Bea Dakestus during her first time in Trenin, guiding her both in music, Apollo worship and even magic. Its not hard to argue that Thena has vastly surpassed Helith in magic, but Helith is perhaps still the stronger musician.

trait.name: Beefy Cowgirl
entries: Leafa has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Improvised Shield
entries: Leafa can use miscellaneous items to gain a +2 bonus to her Armor Class.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Leafa has proficiency with the following; {@item carpenter's tool|phb}, {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}, vehicles and {@item dice set|phb}.

trait.name: Controled Rage
entries: Having faced many hardships, Leafa is good at keeping her anger in check, but might sometimes be tested. At the DM's discretion, Leafa might make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw at the start of her turn to remain calm. On a fail, Leafa must use her Enrage! trait. The DC increases for each friendly creature Leafa can see that is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} (increased by 2), or {@variantrule Dead|XPHB} (increased by 5).
The DM might also decide that Leafa automatically, or even willing, fails this saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Leafa makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Improvised Heavy Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charge (3/Long Rest)
entries: Leafa runs up to 30 feet in a straight line and then makes a Horns attack. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and can move through the space of Large or smaller creatures. Any creature who's space she moves through must chose between falling {@condition prone} or taking {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage. Leafa cannot take this action if her speed is 0.

action.name: I Got Friends (1/1)
entries: Leafa calls in a favour in the South Docks. The favour must be something a criminal orginsation or a network of dock workers can reasonably achieve with little risk, such as smuggling a person or contraband, threatening a business owner, acquiring a vehicle or delaying shipments.

bonus.name: Enrage! (1/Long Rest)
entries: Leafa is good at keeping her temper in check, but if she does let go, you'd better not be in the way. She gains the following effects for the next 10 minutes, until she is knocked {@condition unconscious}, or she calms down (decided by the DM):

items: Leafa loses most of her rational thinking and becomes overwhelmingly dedicated to a particular destructive goal, such as killing a particular enemy or destroying a particular object. Any creatures attempting to stop her may be seen as hostile, regardless of their previous relationship.
Leafa has advantage on all attack rolls and ability checks related to pursuing her goal.
Leafa's Strength score becomes 24.
Leafa has resistance to all damage.
Leafa's speed becomes 60 feet.
If a section of a nonmagical structure has 15 AC or lower, has 30 hit points or fewer and is less than 1 foot thick, Leafa can move through it as difficult terrain. This includes most wooden walls.

reaction.name: Can't keep me down! (5/LR)
entries: When Leafa fails a saving throw or takes damage, she can use a reaction to reroll the saving throw or gain resistance to the triggering damage.

Leafa is a minotaur dock worker, working many odd jobs. Her hulky form naturally gets her lots of work in heavy lifting, but she is also skilled in woodworking and driving. She is also a member of the Birds of Prey, where these skills, along with the connections she makes in the South Docks, are greatly useful to the group.

Minotaurs are not common in Trenin. Combined with the general hardships of commonfolk in Trenin, Leafa faces many frustrations and challenges. Leafa has to manage her anger carefully to avoid making things worse. In spite of all this, Leafa is incredibly friendly and often the most chipper in the room. Just don't get in her way when she does let go.

trait.name: Glamorous
entries: Over the course of 10 minutes, Peto can transform into Cloud Nine or back into Peto. As Cloud Nine, they have advantage on Charisma checks and saving throws, but has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and their speed is reduced by 10 feet due to high heels.

trait.name: One-armed Bandit
entries: Peto is missing their left arm, however, they can use their dexterity and air current control to componsate. They can climb effectively, wield weapons as if they were using two hands and can still attack while grappling one creature.

trait.name: Currents (5/Long Rest)
entries: When Peto takes the Attack or Dash action on their turn, Peto can apply the {@condition weighted|J:general} or {@condition lightened|J:general} condition to either themself or a creature they hit with an attack for 1 minute, or until Peto ends it (no action required).
Alternatively, Peto can use this trait on themself as a reaction to being {@condition grappled} or falling.

trait.name: Starstruck Strike (3/Long Rest)
entries: When Peto hits a creature with a weapon attack, they can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma modifier) or become {@condition stunned|phb} until the start of Peto's next turn. On a success, the creature is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} for the duration instead.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Peto has proficiency with the following; {@item diguise kit|phb}, {@item thieves' tools|phb}, {@item bagpipes|phb}, {@item flute|phb}, and {@item playing cards|phb}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Leafa makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Glass Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Everyone on Cloud Nine (1/1)
entries: Cloud Nine rallies her fans to a cause, such as spreading misinformation, distributing small items to the public, or leading a chant in public. The fans will not willingly put themselves in obvious danger.

bonus.name: Breezy Action
entries: Peto takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action, or makes a melee attack.

bonus.name: Wind under Wings (1/Long Rest)
entries: Peto gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed for 1 minute.
Alternatively, Peto can touch another creature and cast the {@spell levitate|phb} spell on them.

reaction.name: Sailing Load
entries: When Peto, or a creature they can see within 30 feet, makes a Strength (Athletics) check, Peto can use a reaction to give the roll advantage or disadvantage (Peto's choice) as they summon winds to help or hinder the effort.

Peto is a nimble air genasi with command or air currents. Like the rest of the Birds of Prey, Peto has a grievance with the current government and police of Trenin. Even among the Birds of Prey, Peto has a rather relaxed attitude to maiming and killing nobles, greycapes and bluecapes, possibly even taking joy from it.

Peto has a drag persona known as Cloud Nine. Cloud Nine is a local celebrity performer and boasts a small but loyal following. Cloud Nine appears far more confident and performative than Peto, but also less cautious, sometimes getting carried away by the performance.

trait.name: Princess and Pauper
entries: Over the course of a minute, Penny transforms her appearance and demeanour into one of the following guises, which last until she uses this trait again:

items.name: Lady Penelope
entries: Appearing as a prim and proper noble of Rubin, Penelope has advantage on abilty checks made to socially interact with, or blend in with, nobles and creatures who respect nobility and wealth, however, she has disadvantage on such checks with those who dislike nobility and wealth.

items.name: Penny
entries: Appearing as a simple, and sometimes drunk, commoner, Penny has advantage on abilty checks made to socially interact with, or blend in with, working class folk, especially those who dislike nobles and frequent alehouses, however, she has disadvantage on such checks with those who value nobility and wealth.

trait.name: Drinking Game Master
entries: Penelope has advantage on saving throws against posion damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition, and has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Penelope has proficiency with the following; {@item thieves' tools|phb}, harp, {@item flute|phb}, and {@item playing cards|phb}.

action.name: Improvised Shiv
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition distracted|J:general} until the start of Penelope's next turn.

action.name: Improvised Thrown Weapon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Feint or Faint (3/Long Rest)
entries: When Penelope is within 5 feet of a humanoid creature, she can do one of the following:

items.name: Damesel in Distress (Lady Penelope Only)
entries: Penelope accuses the creature of attacking or offending her, crying out for help from a second humanoid within 30 feet that can see or hear her. The second creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma modifier) or view the first creature as hostile and spend an action on its next turn reprimanding, grappling or even attacking the first creature (DM's discretion). Afterwhich, the second creature might no longer see the first as hostile. A creature that dislikes nobility or sees Penelope as hostile has advantage on the saving throw.

items.name: Distracting Troublemaker (Penny Only)
entries: Penny distracts the creature with pocket sand, misleading feints or rude insults. Attack rolls made by other creatures against the target have advantage until the start of Penny's next turn, until she is more than 5 feet from the creature, or an attack hits the creature. When an attack roll hits the creature, Penny can use a reaction to make the attack deal an additional {@dice 2d6} damage and she can move up to half her movement without provoking opportunity attacks as part of the same reaction.

action.name: Belittle or Bewilder (1/Long Rest)
entries: Either by barking misleading and contradictory orders as Lady Penelope or employing various dirty tricks and feints as Penny, Penelope casts the {@spell confusion|xphb} spell at 5th-level (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma Modifier).

action.name: Money makes the world go round (1/1)
entries: Penelope can use her noble connections to call in a favour. The favour must be something that can be achieved with the status or wealth of minor nobility, such as acquiring a valuable antique, bribing an official, or something else the DM deems appropriate.

bonus.name: Dainty Light Fingers (5/Long Rest)
entries: Penny forces a creature within 5 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC + PB + Charisma modifier). On a fail, Penny steals one of the following items from the creature, she can throw the item up to 15 feet as part of the same bonus action:

items: One item being held or loosely carried by the creature.

An important or sentimental item. The creature is distracted until they retrieve it. In addition, as a bonus action within the next 10 minutes, a creature holding the item that can be seen by the target can force the target to repeat the saving throw. On a fail, the target is {@condition taunted|J:general} by the creature holding the item until the end of the target's next turn.
A random treasure or tricket worth gp equal to twice the creature's CR.
A {@item Potion of Healing|dmg}. It ceases to be magical after one hour.

entries: Alternatively, Penny can plant a tiny item she is holding on the person.

bonus.name: Just a Commoner (Penny Only)
entries: Penny can {@action Hide} as a bonus action. She can also attempt to hide in a crowded area such as a markeplace or tavern. When she does so, she can make a Charisma (Deception) check in place of a Dexterity (Stealth). Being visible does not necessarily reveal her location so long as she acts as part of the normal crowd.

bonus.name: Fear of Friends in High Places (Lady Penelope Only)
entries: Penelope uses her status and connections to instil hesitation in her enemies. Until the start of Penelope's next turn, she has a bonus to her Armor Class and Wisdom saving throws equal to her Charisma modifier.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When Penelope takes damage from an attack, she can use a reaction to half the damage she takes.
Lady Penelope is a minor noble lady from Rubin.

Despite the luxuries of her station, Penelope is never truly satisfied with that life. She occasionally takes on the persona of Penny the Urchin, a commoner who frequents alehouses, enjoying the drink and company. As Penny, she can blend in remarkably well.

trait.name: Rapport Spores
entries: Yavius can telepathically communicate with creatures within 30 feet.

trait.name: Undercover Artist
entries: Yavius can cast {@spell disguise self|phb} (DC equals 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) at will.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Yavius has proficiency with the following; {@item painter's supplies|phb} and {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb}.

action.name: Painted Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one Large or smaller target. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained|phb} until it is freed. The creature, or another creature within 5 feet, can make a Strength (Athletics) check (DC 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) to break it free. Dealing 5 acid or slashing damage to the net also frees the creature.

action.name: Poison Spores
entries: Yavius chooses a creature they can see within 15 feet. the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) or take {@damage 3d12} poison damage. A creature takes half damage on a success.

action.name: Pacifying Spores (3/Long Rest)
entries: Yavius chooses a creature they can see within 5 feet. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) or be {@condition Stunned|phb} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: You'll need a hero! (1/Long Rest)
entries: Yavius creates 1 Enchanted Eden Mauler or 15 First Dawn Maulers in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet. The maulers act independently and are hostile to all non-mauler creatures. The maulers fade after one minute or when they reach 0 hit points.

action.name: Masterpiece (1/1)
entries: Yavius creates and distrubtes a great work, or series of works. The work might persuade groups of people to rally to a particular cause, or might pass a distribute a secret message to a wide audience.

bonus.name: Oil Object (5/Long Rest)
entries: Yavius creates a non-magical object that fits within a 5-foot cube. The creation may appear like multiple separate objects or a larger object folded up, but it is still treated as a single rigid and opaque object. The object is clearly painted, has an AC of 15 and 10 hit points. It is immune to poison and psychic damage but vulnerable to acid damage. It is also immune to all conditions. The object disappears after 10 minutes or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.
Yavius is a famous painter in Trenin, known for impressionist paintings of lone heroes standing up to giant threats, such as monsters and hordes.
A secret known only to a few is that Yavius is not actually a single person, but a fungal colony acting as one. They employ disguises and agents to hide their true nature from the public.

hp.special: Eight times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Bomber is a retainer, as described on page 9 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions.

trait.name: Dwarven Resiliance
entries: Bomber has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Follower of Tresmed
entries: Bomber acknowledges many gods, but primarily follows Tresmed, the Litinvr god of woodworking. Bomber has proficiency with {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}.

action.name: Signature Attack (Longbow)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 plus PB} piercing damage.
Beginning at 7th level, bomber can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

action.name: 5th Level: Special Shot (5/Day)
entries: Bomber makes a signature attack against all creatures in 20-foot cone or 30-foot line.

action.name: 7th Level: Arcane Arrowsmith (3/Day)
entries: Using woodcarver's tools, bomber touches a nonmagical arrow, and transforms it into a trick arrow of his choice from the following list; {@item emetic arrow|J:Ammo}, {@item enlarging arrow|J:Ammo}, {@item entrapping arrow|J:Ammo}, {@item forceful arrow|J:Ammo}, {@item shielding arrow|J:Ammo}, {@item shrinking arrow|J:Ammo} or {@item smoking arrow|J:Ammo}.
The arrow remains magical until used, or until the next dawn. The arrow can be given to other creatures, they instinctively know the arrows will become mundane at the next dawn.

At the DM's discretion, Bomber can learn to produce other types of uncommon trick arrows. For example, he might find a new type of trick ammunition and study it over the course of a long rest, adding it to the list above at the end of the rest.

bonus.name: 3rd Level: Acrobatic Archer (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Bomber jumps up to 5xPB feet without provoking opportunity attacks. During this jump, Bomber can make a signature attack. If Bomber is above the target, this attack has advantage. On a hit, this attack deals PB extra damage.

hp.special: Eight times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Gomber is a retainer, as described on page 9 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions.

trait.name: Dwarven Resiliance
entries: Gomber has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Follower of Olga
entries: Gomber acknowledges many gods, but primarily follows Olga, the Litinvr god of feasting. Gomber has proficiency with brewer's supplies.

action.name: Signature Attack (Hop Vine Whip)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6} piercing damage and a Large or smaller target is pulled 10 feet towards Gomber.
Beginning at 7th level, Gomber deals an additional {@dice 1d6} with this attack.

action.name: 5th Level: Magic Drinks (3/Day)
entries: Gomber casts one of the following spells at 2nd-level; {@spell cure wounds|phb}, {@spell entangle|phb}, {@spell goodberry|phb} or {@spell lesser restoration|phb}.

Wisdom is their spellcasting ability, and these spells often take forms associated with drinking and feasting. For example, goodberry might appear as small drinks while entangle might appear as hop vines or spectral feasters.

action.name: 7th Level: WIP
entries: Gomber lets out an intoxicating belch. Creatures within 10 feet of Gomber must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10 +PB) or become poisoned for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

bonus.name: 3rd Level: Skinchange (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action,  Gomber transforms into a more bestial form for the next hour, or until they are reduced to 0 hit points. Gomber chooses the appearance of their new form, however, their statistics do not change, except they can choose to become Small or Medium and they gain two of the following additional effects for the duration of the form:

items.name: Keen Senses
entries: Gomber gains advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

items.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Gomber's unarmed strikes use Wisdom in place of Strength for the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals 1d8 + PB bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage depending on the nature of the weapons.

Beginning at 7th level, Gomber can make two unarmed strikes when they take the Attack action while in skinchange form, and these attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

items.name: Hulking Frame
entries: Gomber becomes Large and has advantage on Strength checks. This effect cannot be chosen at the same time as Tiny Frame.

items.name: Scrambler
entries: Gomber gains a climbing speed equal to their walking speed and their jump distance is doubled.

items.name: Swimmer
entries: Gomber gains a swimming speed equal to their walking speed and they can breathe underwater.

items.name: Tiny Frame
entries: Gomber becomes Tiny and has advantage on Dexterity checks. This effect cannot be chosen at the same time as Hulking Frame.

items.name: Tough Hide
entries: Gomber gains temporary hit points equal to three times their level. They lose these temporary hit points when the skinchange ends.

hp.special: Eight times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Somber is a retainer, as described on page 9 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions.

trait.name: Dwarven Resiliance
entries: Somber has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Follower of Skjalver
entries: Somber acknowledges many gods, but primarily follows Skjalver, the Imiskr god of death. Somber also has proficiency with {@item body modder's tools|J:General}.

action.name: Signature Attack (Longshoreman's Hook)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d4 plus PB} piercing damage. Alternatively, on a hit, Somber can forgo damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against the attack roll or fall @{condition prone|phb}.
Beginning at 7th level, Somber can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Death Smite (3/Day)
entries: When Somber hits a creature with a signature attack, they can deal an additional PBd6 necrotic damage.

action.name: 5th Level: Fear of Death (3/Day)
entries: Somber chooses PB creatures that they can see within 30 feet. Each creature must make a DC 10 plus PB Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of somber for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). Somber has advantage on attack rolls against creatures frightened by them.

reaction.name: 7th Level: Bolstering Aura (3/Day)
entries: When a creature Somber can see within 30 feet makes a saving throw, Somber can use a reaction to grant them a PB bonus to the saving throw.

tools: Choose 1 from; {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|phb}, {@item Cartographer's Tools|phb}, {@item Forgery Kit|phb}, {@item Herbalism Kit|phb}, {@item Thieves' Tools|phb}, {@item Navigator's Tools|phb}, {@item Painter's Supplies|phb}

default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|type=martial weapon=sand|category=basic} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial or simple weapons|items|source=phb|type=martial weapon;simple weapon=sor|category=basic}
(a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (c) {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}
A {@item dagger|phb}, a {@item grappling hook|phb} and a notebook.

fluff.name: Lorehunter
entries: WIP

tools: Choose 1 from; {@item Alchemist's Supplies|phb}, {@item Herbalist's Kit|phb} and {@item Poisoner's Kit|phb}

default: (a) {@item quarterstaff|phb} or (b) a {@item shortbow|phb} and 20 {@item arrow|phb|arrows}
(a) a {@item component pouch|phb} or (b) an {@item druidic focus|phb}
(a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) or an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
Two {@item dagger|phb|daggers}, 5 candles and a witch's hood, hat or headdress.

tools: Choose 1 from; {@item Alchemist's Supplies|phb}, {@item Herbalist's Kit|phb} and {@item Poisoner's Kit|phb}

fluff.name: Witch
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: Calculated Strike
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can utilize your knowledge to pinpoint weak spots and improve the damage you deal with weapons. Once per turn, when you hit with a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can add a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Expertise
entries: At 1st level, choose up to two skills, instruments, tools or vehicles with which you are proficient. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies. When you gain a level in this class you can replace one of these proficiencies with a different one.

entries.name: Optional Variant: Expert Topics
entries: Sometimes specialist knowledge of a particular topic is more useful than general knowledge in a skill or device. If your DM allows, you can choose a specialist topic in place of a proficiency for your Scholarly Expertise feature. When you make an ability check that utilises your specialist topic, you can add your proficiency bonus. If you already add your proficiency bonus, the bonus is doubled for this check.

Work with your DM to define the scope and depth of the topic. This could be knowledge of a particular faction, including its history, politics and laws; it could be knowledge of a particular deity or being and their followers; it could be knowledge of the anatomy and behaviors of particular kinds of creatures; it could be knowledge of a particular school of magic or any other topic you and your DM deem appropriate.

For example, you may study demons and posses expert knowledge about them. With the demon topic in your book, you may double your proficiency for checks made to identify, track or recall lore about creatures with the demon tag.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB|mastery properties} of two kinds of {@filter weapons|items|type=simple weapon;martial weapon} of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Spear|XPHB|Spears} and {@item Shortswords|XPHB|Shortswords}.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB|mastery properties} of {@item Pike|XPHB|Pikes} and {@item Warhammer|XPHB|Warhammers}.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to draw on arcane magic through study and practice to cast spells as a Wizard does. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the {@filter lorehunter spell list|spells|class=lorehunter (j:lore)}.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Lorehunter Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two {@filter level 1 Lorehunter spells|spells|class=Lorehunter (WIP)|level=1}. {@spell Catapult|XPHB} and {@spell Grease|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Paladin levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Lorehunter Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Lorehunter spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Lorehunter Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 5 Lorehunter, your list of prepared spells can include six Lorehunter spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Lorehunter feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Lorehunter spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace one spell on your list with another Lorehunter spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Lorehunter spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item arcane focus|phb} or a book as a spellcasting focus for your Lorehunter spells.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice. Instead of choosing one of those feats, you can choose the option below.

entries.name: Arcane Warrior
entries: You learn two {@filter Wizard cantrips|spells|level=0|class=Cleric} of your choice. The chosen cantrips count as Lorehunter spells for you, and Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a Lorehunter level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Wizard cantrip.

classFeature.name: Studious Action
entries: Starting at 2nd Level, you can take the {@action Help|XPHB}, {@action Search|XPHB} or {@action Study|XPHB} action as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Lorehunter Subclass
entries: At 3rd level, you choose an academic society from which you gained your knowledge and skills. This society may be an order that you belong to, or that you have acquired knowledge and skills from by other means, with or without their permission. Alternatively, it could be a person or figure that has taught or inspired you to pursue your search for knowledge.
Your choice grants features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Arcane Sense
entries: At 3rd level, you hone your senses with and for the arcane. Choose one of the following options:

items.name: Spellsense
entries: As an action, you can expand a spell slot and focus your senses to search for the presence of magic. For the next 10 minutes, you can sense when a creature within 60ft of you casts a spell. You know the location the spell was cast from and the school of magic that the spell belongs to.

items.name: Arcane Mind
entries: Choose a {@filter level 1 spell from the divination school of magic and that has a range of self|spells|level=1|components & miscellaneous=|school=d|range=self;self (area)}. You can cast the chosen spell at will, without requiring a a spell slot. When you gain a level in this class, you can change the chosen spell for a different one.

classFeature.name: Invigorating Knowledge
entries: Starting at 4th level, learning new things or successfully applying existing knowledge grants you an inspiring feeling of satisfaction. When you succeed on an Intelligence check, or a creature you aid with the {@action Help|XPHB} action succeeds on an Intelligence check, you can gain temporary hit points equal to twice your Intelligence modifier (Minimum of 1).

classFeature.name: Careful Stride
entries: Starting at 6th level, on your turn you can choose to move carefully to avoid certain dangers. Until the start of your next turn, you are {@condition slowed|J:general} and you cannot take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, but you make no noise as a result of moving and you have advantage on saving throws against traps, spells and effects that are triggered by your weight or movement. In addition, attacks against you that are triggered by your weight or movement, such as opportunity attacks or readied attacks, have disadvantage. You cannot use this feature if you have already moved in this turn.

classFeature.name: Additional Expertise
entries: At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (or specialist topics) to gain the benefit of your Scholary Expertise.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature from your Lorehunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Robust Mind
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you fail an Intelligence or Wisdom saving throw, you can reroll the saving throw and take the new result. You can use this feature twice and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Improved Arcane Sense
entries: At 10th level, your unique senses become stronger.

items.name: Spellsense
entries: When a creature that is concentrating on a spell enters the area of your Spellsense for the first time on a turn, or starts its turn there, you know their location and the school of magic.

items.name: Arcane Mind
entries: You can choose an additional spell for your Arcane Mind. The spell can be of {@filter level 2 or lower |spells|level=1;2|components & miscellaneous=|school=d|range=self;self (area)}but must still be from the divination school of magic and have a range of self.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature from your Lorehunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature from your Lorehunter Subclass.

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Through rituals and charms, you cast witch spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the {@filter witch spell list|spells|class=witch}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the witch spell list. You learn additional witch cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the witch table. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the witch spell list.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The witch table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your witch spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of witch spells that are available for you to cast. To do so, choose a number of witch spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + your witch level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you're a 3rd-level witch, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination, chosen from your spellbook. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell magic missile}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of witch spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your witch spells; your understanding of the theory behind magic allows you to wield these spells with superior skill.
